intro: Dolichos stolzii, commonly known as the yellow burr legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and long, twisted pods. The plant typically grows in shrubland and grassland habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its seeds are enclosed in hard, spiny pods that can persist in the soil for extended periods. Dolichos stolzii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
